c74object.name: bach.delace
c74object.description: Redistributes elements of an llll into several output lllls, in a round-robin fashion.

objarg.name: parameters
objarg.digest: number of outlets / mono mode and number of sublists
objarg.description:
A single integer argument is the number of outlets over which the incoming llll should be de-interleaved.
If the first or only argument is the mono symbol, bach.delace works in "mono" mode, that is the incoming llll is de-interleaved into sublists of a single llll. In this case, the number of the resulting sublists is set via the count attribute, or the second argument.

method.name: bang
method.description: Returns the last set of de-interleaved lllls.

method.name: llll
method.description: In standard mode: the elements of the llll are redistributed into several output lllls according to the number of outlets of the object (standard mode) or into several sublists of one output llll according to the count attribute (mono mode), in a round-robin fashion.

attribute.name: count
attribute.description: Number of output sublists in mono mode; ignored in standard mode.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.
